benchmark_details.name: SimBench
benchmark_details.overview: SimBench is a benchmark designed to evaluate the proficiency of student large language models (S-LLMs) in generating digital twins (DTs) for simulators, enabling ranking based on their ability to produce high-quality DTs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure the ability of student large language models to generate effective digital twins for simulation scenarios.

data.source: A dataset with 102 exemplary demonstrations categorized into 34 distinct physical systems, manually curated by simulation experts.

methods: Automated evaluation using a rule-based judge LLM (J-LLM)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of generated digital twins compared to expert-provided ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher pass@1 scores indicate better performance in generating accurate digital twins.
methodology.validation: Evaluation framework is optimized using expert feedback on ground truth code.
